verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Psalm of David.) How <S%H575><s%> long, <S%H5704><s%> O Lord <S%H3068><s%>? Wilt Thou forget <S%H7911><s%> me forever <S%H5331><s%>? How <S%H575><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> wilt Thou hide <S%H5641><s%> Thy face <S%H6440><s%> from me?

How <S%H575><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> shall I take <S%H7896><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%> in my soul, <S%H5315><s%> [Having] sorrow <S%H3015><s%> in my heart <S%H3824><s%> all the day <S%H3119><s%>? How <S%H575><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> will my enemy <S%H340><s%> be exalted <S%H7311><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> me?

Consider <S%H5027><s%> [and] answer <S%H6030><s%> me, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> my God; <S%H430><s%> Enlighten <S%H215><s%> my eyes, <S%H5869><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> I sleep <S%H3462><s%> the [sleep of] death, <S%H4194><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> my enemy <S%H340><s%> say, <S%H559><s%> "I have overcome <S%H3201><s%> him," [Lest] my adversaries <S%H6862><s%> rejoice <S%H1523><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> I am shaken. <S%H4131><s%>
But I have trusted <S%H982><s%> in Thy lovingkindness; <S%H2617><s%> My heart <S%H3820><s%> shall rejoice <S%H1523><s%> in Thy salvation. <S%H3444><s%>
I will sing <S%H7891><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> He has dealt <S%H1580><s%> bountifully <S%H1580><s%> with me.
